DOC.detailed_description: Objective The aim present study : 1 . Clarify altered plasticity primary motor cortex ( M1 ) patient Parkinson 's disease ( PD ) associate impaired motor learn use paired associative stimulation ( PAS ) technique , enhance inhibit M1 excitability pair stimulation contralateral peripheral nerve cerebral cortex . 2 . Elucidate altered plasticity M1 patient PD go together impaired sensorimotor integration via basal ganglia-thalamocortical loop . Study population 12 right-handed patient PD 12 right-handed age-matched healthy volunteer Design Patients age-matched healthy volunteer complete five different session : Visit 1 : clinical screening ; Visit 2 : motor learn session ; Visit 3 4 : pair associative stimulation ( PAS ) session ; Visit 5 : control session . During motor learn session , subject ask perform metronome-paced pinch index finger thumb . During PAS session , receive 20 minute paired stimulation contralateral peripheral nerve stimulation transcranial magnetic stimulation ( TMS ) appropriate time produce change M1 excitability . During control session , receive 20 minute repetitive TMS without peripheral nerve stimulation . Outcome measure For motor learn session : - peak acceleration ( MPA ) thumb movement - maximal peak force ( MPF ) index finger thumb For PAS control session : - peak-to-peak motor evoke potential ( MEP ) amplitude - rest motor threshold - afferent inhibition - event related desynchronization ( ERD ) event relate synchronization ( ERS )
